io.atomix

Class Atomix

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.Atomix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Managed<Atomix>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomixClient, AtomixReplica

    public abstract class Atomix
extends Object
implements Managed<Atomix>
    Base type for creating and managing distributed resources in a Atomix cluster.

    Resources are user provided stateful objects backed by a distributed state machine. This class facilitates the creation and management of Resource objects via a filesystem like interface. There is a one-to-one relationship between paths and resources, so each path can be associated with one and only one resource.

    To create a resource, pass the resource Class to the create(String, Class) method. When a resource is created, the StateMachine associated with the resource will be created on each Raft server and future operations submitted for that resource will be applied to the state machine. Internally, resource state machines are multiplexed across a shared Raft log.

    Resource implementations serve as a user-friendly interface through which to submit commands and queries to the underlying CopycatClient client.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • get

        public <T extends Resource> CompletableFuture<T> get(String path,
                                                     Class<? super T> type)
        Gets the resource at the given path.

        If a resource at the given path already exists, the existing resource will be returned, otherwise a new resource of the given type will be created.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The resource type.
        Parameters:
        path - The path at which to get the resource.
        type - The expected resource type.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the resource has been loaded.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if path or type are null

      • create

        public <T extends Resource> CompletableFuture<T> create(String path,
                                                        Class<? super T> type)
        Creates a resource at the given path.

        If the resource at the given path already exists, a new Resource object will be returned with a reference to the existing resource state in the cluster.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The resource type.
        Parameters:
        path - The path at which to create the resource.
        type - The resource type to create.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the resource has been created.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if path or type are null
